netz 0.3.0

    • Estimating population usage from input distribution

Package index

All functions

access_to_crop()
Predict the nets per capita associated witha given access
access_to_usage()
Convert access to usage
crop_to_access()
Predict the access nets associated with a given nets per capita
crop_to_distribution()
Convert nets per capita to annual nets per capital delivered
crop_to_distribution_dynamic()
Dynamic crop to distribution estimation
distribution_to_crop()
Convert annual nets per capital delivered to nets per capita
distribution_to_crop_dynamic()
Dynamic distribution to crop estimation
dynamic_crop()
Cumulative crop
dynamic_opti()
Optimise distribution
exp_loss_equilibrium()
Estimate average population usage given at equilibrium
fit_usage()
Fit distribution to match target usage using non-linear optimisation. This assumes an exponentially distributed net loss function and randomly correlated net distribution.
fit_usage_objective()
Internal objective function for least-squares non-linear fitting of target usage
get_halflife_data()
Reading in and formatting half life datasets
get_npc_data()
Function for reading in and access and npc data
get_usage_rate_data()
Function for reading in and formatting usage rate datasets
net_loss_exp()
Function of net loss over time from malariasimulation Net loss is exponential.
net_loss_map()
Function of net loss over time.
npc_fits
Loess and linear model fits to npc access data.
objective()
Cumu objetive function
population_usage()
Estimate the time series of population-level bed net usage from a vector of bed net distributions. This is fixed for an exponentially distributed net retention, as implemented in malariasimulation
shifted()
Shift the net loss function
usage_to_access()
Convert usage to access

Developed by Pete Winskill, Nora Schmit, Ines Gerard-Ursin.
